content:
Sure, here are some examples of the duration of sunrises in other cities in Australia during the summer solstice:

- Sydney: Located approximately 34 degrees south of the equator, Sydney experiences a sunrise duration of around 35-40 minutes on the day of the summer solstice. On this day, the sun rises in Sydney at around 5:42 am and sets at around 8:18 pm, resulting in approximately 14 hours of daylight.

- Perth: Located approximately 32 degrees south of the equator, Perth experiences a sunrise duration of around 50-60 minutes on the day of the summer solstice. On this day, the sun rises in Perth at around 5:03 am and sets at around 7:33 pm, resulting in approximately 14.5 hours of daylight.

- Darwin: Located approximately 12 degrees south of the equator, Darwin experiences a sunrise duration of around 65-70 minutes on the day of the summer solstice. On this day, the sun rises in Darwin at around 6:16 am and sets at around 6:39 pm, resulting in approximately 12.5 hours of daylight.

It's worth noting that the duration of sunrises can vary based on several factors such as the actual location within the city, weather conditions, and topography. Additionally, the duration of the sunrise can fluctuate slightly from year to year based on the position of the earth in its orbit around the sun.
